doc.after: Europeans first arrived in the region with the 1502 voyage of Amerigo Vespucci. The Spanish navigators Juan DÃ­az de SolÃ­s and Sebastian Cabot visited the territory that is now Argentina in 1516 and 1526, respectively.[11] In 1536 Pedro de Mendoza founded the small settlement of Buenos Aires, which was abandoned in 1541.[32]
